org.docheinstein.mp3doctor.song.player

Class SongPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.docheinstein.mp3doctor.song.player.SongPlayer

  • public class SongPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an entity that is able to play songs, and allow basic operations such as play/pause the song.

    Furthermore this player allow to play a queue of song and thus allow some advanced operations such as go to the next or go to the previous song.

    It is even possible to listen to the state of the song this player is handling via the SongPlayer.SongPlayerListener interface.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SongPlayer.SongPlayerListener
      Interface that let listeners to observe the state of this player and the state of song it is handling at the moment.

      Queue of the songs that have to be reproduced.

    • Method Detail

      • instance

        public static SongPlayer instance()
        Returns the unique instance of this class.
        Returns:
        the unique instance of this class

      • addListener

        public void addListener(SongPlayer.SongPlayerListener listener)
        Adds a listener that will be notified when the state of the player change.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener that will listen to the state of the player

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(SongPlayer.SongPlayerListener listener)
        Removes a previously added listener from the listener set.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener that won't listen to the state of the player anymore

      • play

        public void play(Song song)
        Plays the given song without any play queue (i.e. when the song finishes nothing is player and next/prev is not available).
        Parameters:
        song - the song to play
        See Also:
        play(List, Song), play(List, int)

      • play

        public void play(java.util.List<Song> songQueue,
                 Song song)
        Plays the given song using the given play queue.

        Note that the song MUST be within the elements of the song queue, otherwise this method aborts.

        Parameters:
        songQueue - the play queue
        song - the first song to play of the play queue

      • play

        public void play(java.util.List<Song> songQueue,
                 int firstSongIndex)
        Plays the song at the given index within the given play queue.
        Parameters:
        songQueue - the play queue
        firstSongIndex - the index of the first song to play of the play queue

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pauses the song that is currently playing.

        This does nothing if no song is playing at the moment.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resumes the songs previously paused via pause().

        This does nothing if the current song is not in pause.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the song that is currently playing.

        This does nothing if no song is playing at the moment.

      • next

        public void next()
        Plays the next song in the play queue, if possible.

      • prev

        public void prev()
        Plays the previous song in the play queue, if possible.

      • isInitialized

        public boolean isInitialized()
        Returns whether the underlying media player has been initialized.

        The media player is actually initialized if at least a song has been played through this player with play(List, Song) or an analog method.

        Returns:
        whether the media player is initialized

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        Returns whether the current song is playing.
        Returns:
        whether the current song is playing

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Returns whether the current song is paused.
        Returns:
        whether the current song is paused

      • onSongStarted

        private void onSongStarted()
        Handles the start of the song; start the periodic progress task and notifies the listeners about the state change.

      • onSongStopped

        private void onSongStopped()
        Handles the stop of the song; stops the periodic progress task and notifies the listeners about the state change.

      • onSongFinished

        private void onSongFinished()
        Handles the finish of the song; stops the periodic progress task and notifies the listeners about the state change.

        Furthermore, this starts the next song, if possible.

      • startSongProgressTask

        private void startSongProgressTask()
        Starts the periodic progress task that notifies the listeners about the progress of the song every second.

        The started task can be stopped via stopSongProgressTask().

      • stopSongProgressTask

        private void stopSongProgressTask()
        Stops the periodic progress task.
